CONJUGATES: snacks (n. pl.) | snacks (v. 3rd sg.) | snacking (v. pres. part.) | snacked (v. past)
ETYMOLOGY: Originates from 18th-century English, possibly borrowed from or related to Middle Dutch *snacken* ('to snap, bite'). Originally meant 'a snap or bite' (1700s), later applied to the food itself (1800s).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A small quantity of food eaten between regular meals or in place of a meal; a light bite.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 两顿正餐之间或代替正餐吃的少量食物；零食；点心。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I try to choose healthy snacks instead of junk food in the afternoon.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我尽量选择健康的零食而不是垃圾食品作为下午茶。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To eat a small amount of food between regular meals.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was snacking on almonds while studying for her exam.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她一边为考试复习，一边吃着杏仁。
